❌ FAKE Headlines (2025–2026)
Bill Gates caught in massive vaccine conspiracy scandal — FAKE
No credible evidence supports claims of Bill Gates being involved in vaccine-related conspiracies.
Aliens seen shopping at Walmart in Texas — FAKE
Reports of aliens shopping at Walmart are unfounded and stem from misinterpreted sightings.
5G towers are spreading COVID-19 according to secret reports — FAKE
Scientific studies have debunked the myth linking 5G technology to the spread of COVID-19.
NASA confirms Earth is flat in secret document — FAKE
NASA has consistently provided evidence supporting the Earth's spherical shape; no such document exists.
Politician claims to time travel using ancient pyramid power — FAKE
There are no credible reports of politicians claiming time travel through pyramid energy.
Drinking bleach cures COVID-19, says online article — FAKE
Health authorities warn against ingesting bleach; such claims are dangerous and false.
Zombie outbreak reported in remote Russian village — FAKE
No verified incidents of zombie outbreaks have been reported; such stories are fictional.
New study says Earth is hollow with hidden civilizations — FAKE
The hollow Earth theory lacks scientific basis and is considered a conspiracy theory.
Man claims to control weather using crystals — FAKE
Claims of weather control through crystals are pseudoscientific and unsubstantiated.
Secret military base on the moon discovered by hacker — FAKE
No credible evidence supports the existence of a secret lunar military base discovered by hackers.
